title: Geth crashing every few days on macbook pro
body:
Hi everyone my geth seems to be crashing every few days and takes about 12-36 hours to resync on its own. Im using a macbook pro 16gb ram 2tb ssd i7 processor. I have my geth cache at 4096 and my ram allowance on docker mode is 7GB. 

#### System information

Rocket Pool client version: 1.6.5
Rocket Pool service version: 1.6.5
Selected Eth 1.0 client: Geth (Locally managed)
	Image: ethereum/client-go:v1.10.25
Selected Eth 2.0 client: Lighthouse (Locally managed)
	Image: sigp/lighthouse:v3.1.2
OS & Version: OSX
Commit hash : (if `develop`)

#### Expected behaviour

#### Actual behaviour


Can you find the crash logs? The log you posted is only for recovery stage

> 6gb ram 2tb ssd i7 processor. I have my geth cache at 4096 and my ram allowance on docker mode is 7GB.

The problem here is that you set a ram allowance on docker, at 7GB.
Geth (due to how the golang memory allocation works) may at times consume roughly the double of the `--cache` setting. This is a bit UX-unfriendly, but that's how it is. 

On a 16G system, 4G should be fine. But, you are essentially telling docker "please watch the geth process, and if it goes above 7G, then please kill it". 

The only reason I can see for using docker allowance is if you have secondary (less important) processes. and you want to prevent a malfunctioning secondary process from affecting/starving a more important process. So you would set docker ram allowances on those. However, I don't see any reason why one would set a docker ram allowance on geth. 

Now, `geth` does detect that you have constrained it, hence why it's trying to lower the limits to `2317`:   
```
WARN [10-09|11:59:59.951] Sanitizing cache to Go's GC limits       provided=4096 updated=2317
```
But yeah, `2317` is simply too low to be able to sync on, so it blows way past it.
I'd also recommend you to use `ethereum/client-go:latest` instead of `ethereum/client-go:v1.10.25`. We have fixed several issues with sync on `latest`
